abstract.p: Village trustees approves moratorium on palm readers, fortune-tellers, mediums and clairvoyants opening shops along Mamaroneck Avenue, Mamaroneck, NY (S)

block.p: By anyone's estimate of what the future holds, the outlook looks bleak for palm readers and other fortunetellers in the village of Mamaroneck.

By anyone's estimate of what the future holds, the outlook looks bleak for palm readers and other fortunetellers in the village of Mamaroneck.
No mediums. No clairvoyants. No soothsayers, palmists, ''reader advisers, or the like,'' according to a law passed this month by the village's Board of Trustees.

The trustees have established a moratorium on new businesses along Mamaroneck Avenue, the village's main street and appointed a seven-member Mamaroneck Avenue Task Force to study what might be permitted uses.
''Our goal is to determine what is an appropriate use for the avenue and to analyze what's appropriate for the downtown,'' Michael S. Blau, the Village Manager, said.

The village has already limited the number of delicatessens and fast-food establishments on Mamaroneck Avenue because ''it does not want a proliferation of just one kind of store,'' he said, explaining that check-cashing stores and billiard halls were also not welcome in the village.
